intro: Microlicia tetramera, commonly known as the four-merous microlicia, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Microlicia tetramera is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
